titles.title: Mäḥalǝy zä-Sälomon ʾƎbrayǝsṭ, Songs of Salomon (“Hebrew version”) / Miscellaneous prayers / Dawit “Psalter”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Mäḥalǝy zä-Sälomon ʾƎbrayǝsṭ, Songs of Salomon (so called “Hebrew version”) (fols. 2v-3v) Miscellaneous prayers II) Säʿali länä qǝddǝst dǝngǝl Maryam... “Pray for us, Holy Virgin Mary...”: 3 prayers of supplication (fols. 4r-5r) III) Mäsqäl ḫaylänä mäsqäl ṣǝnʿǝnä... “The Cross is our strength, the Cross is our endurance...” (fol. 7r) IV) Wǝddase ʾǝbäyäki Maryam... “The praise of Your greatness, Mary...” (fol. 7r) V) Näʿa ḫabeyä Dawit... “Come to me, David...” (fol. 7v) VI) Dawit “Psalter” (fols. 8r-176ra) VI-1) Mäzmurä Dawit “Psalms of David” (fols. 8r-133vr) VI-2) Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat “The Canticles of the Prophets” (fols. 135r-149v) VI-3) Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy “Song of Songs” (fols. 150r-157v) VI-4) Wǝddase Maryam “Praise of Mary” (fols. 159r-170ra) VI-5) ʾAnqäṣä bǝrhan “The Gate of Light” (fols. 170ra-174vb) VI-6) Yǝweddǝsǝwwa mälaʿǝkt... “The angels praise Her...” (fols. 175ra-176ra)
Additiones 1-2; colophon.

copyists.copyist: According to the colophon, the scribe is qäññ geta Mäkonnän (sic) of Näḉḉ Śar, Wällo, from Mäkanä Sämaʿt Gälawdewos (who copied also the Psalter EMML 2046, for the same commissioner). Most probably the same scribe wrote Ms. AMM-013.

donors.donor: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated by ras Mikaʾel (Mikaʾel ʿAli ?, b. ca. 1847/50, d. 1918).

owners.owner: According to the colophon, the original commissioner was däǧǧazmač Wäle of Wärräbabbo, baptismal name Wäldä Mikaʾel, s. fol. 133v (Wäle Bǝṭul [?] d. 1918; in 1900 he was already “ras”). He is also depicted on the miniatures, fols. 6v and 116v. In the 20th cent. Wärräbabbo or Wärrä Babbo was a wäräda in Ambassäl awrağğa. A few individuals, both diseased and living, including Wälättä Kidan and King Yoḥannǝs (most probably Yoḥannǝs IV), are mentioned in the supplication formulas at the end of Text II. Additionally, Kǝflä Yaʿqob is mentioned in the supplication formulas written in a small script on fols. 4rv, 5r.

dcomments.dcomment: According to the colophon, the Ms. was completed in 1900 year of mercy (= 1908 A.D.), in the 19th year of reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913).

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with dark grey tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the dark grey leather cover (at least 7 tools were used: fivefold line fillet, triple circle, small x, corni form, triple crescent, x-form, cross hatching). Cut-work on parchment on fol. 7.

bnothers.bnother: Two chains of the endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: I(7/s.l.: 6 stub after 5/fols. 1r-7v) – II(8/fols. 8r-15v) – ፪III(8/fols. 16r-23v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 24r-31v) – ፬V(8/s.l.: 7 stub after 6; 2 stub after 1/fols. 32r-39v) – ፭VI(8/fols. 40r-48v) – ፮VII(8/fols. 49r-56v) – ፯VIII(8/s.l.: 6 stub after 5; 3 stub after 2/fols. 57r-64v) – ፰IX(8/s.l.: 6 stub after 5; 3 stub after 2/fols. 65r-72v) – ፱X(8/fols. 73r-80v) – ፲XI(8/fols. 81r-88v) – ፲፩XII(8/fols. 89r-96v) – ፲፪XIII(8/fols. 97r-104v) – ፲፫XIV(8/fols. 105r-112v) – ፲፬XV(8/s.l.: 6 stub after 5; 3 stub after 2/fols. 113r-120v) – ፲፭XVI(8/fols. 121r-128v) – ፲፮XVII(8/fols. 129r-136v) – ፲፯XVIII(8/fols. 137r-144v) – ፲፰XIX(8/fols. 145r-152) – ፲፱XX(8/fols. 153r-160v) – ፳XXI(8/s.l.: 3 stub after 2; 6 stub after 3/fols. 161r-168v) – ፳፩XXII(8/fols. 169r-176v) – B(2/s.l.: 1 stub after 1; 2 stub before 1/fols.177r-178v)

taunit.mr-info: Texts: I-V, VI-1, VI-2, VI-3: all data for fol. 9r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

taunit.mr-info: Texts: VI-4, VI-5, VI-6: all data for fol. 161r.
taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: The letter ች in the word ደጃዝማች (däǧǧazmač) has a particular shape, on fol. 6v.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra (including name of God in Text VI-1); title of Text I; initial line of Texts I, III-V; two initial lines of Text II; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; initial lines of Pss., Canticles and Songs; title and two adjacent lines of the incipit of the daily readings of Text VI-4; title of Texts VI-5 and VI-6; name, number and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; refrains of Pss. 117, 135 and Canticle 10; words ይሴብሕዎ in Ps. 148 and ሰብሕዎ in Ps. 150; a few single words in Texts VI-4, VI-5, VI-6; doxology after each 10 Pss.; initial line of the colophon; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Three groups of adjacent lines on the incipit page of Texts VI-1, VI-2, VI-3, VI-4; two groups of adjacent lines of the first Ps. from the group of 10 Pss.; two groups of adjacent lines of the the incipit of the daily readings of Text VI-4 and of the incipit of Texts VI-5 and VI-6.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - The Ms. is similar to the Psalter EMML 2046 (Däbrä Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, Wällo), completed by the same scribe and commissioned by the same commissioner, däǧǧazmač Wäle. - Text I, not yet properly identified, occurs also in Mss. AGM-002 and AMM-013 where its verses are written between selected lines of the Song of Songs. The same verses appear in the Ethiopic ʾandǝmta-commentary Mäṣaḥǝftä Sälomon wä-Sirak, Addis Ababa 1988 A.M. [1996/97] (from p. 250b onwards) and in Mäzmurä Dawit, Addis Abäba, 1959 A.M. [1966/67]. - Three supplication prayers follow Text VI-1. - Ps. 150 contains additional verses not encountered in the Septuagint nor the printed editions of the Psalter in Gǝʿǝz. - Doxology occurs after each group of 10 Pss., after Texts VI-2 and VI-3.

colophon.tran: Fol. 176rb: This book was written in the year of mercy 1900, in the year of John the Evangelist, while ˁabäqte was 28 and mäṭqˁǝ 2, in the 19th year of reign of Mǝnilǝk, King of Kings of Ethiopia. May God in the Kingdom of Heaven have mercy on them together, däǧğazmač Wäle of Wärräbabbo who commissioned the writing and his scribe qäññ geta Mäkonnän from Mäkanä Sämaˁǝt Gälawdewos. Forever and ever, Amen.
colophon.det: According to the colophnon the Ms. was written in 1900 year of mercy, in the year of John the Evangelist (= 1908 A.D). It mentions the commissioner däǧğazmač Wäle of Wärräbabbo (Wällo), the scribe qäññ geta Mäkonnän and the place of the latter's affiliation, Mäkanä Sämaʿt Gälawdewos (Näḉḉ Śar, Wällo).

additional.tran: Fol. 1: This book was purchase by ˀabba Zä-Mikaˀel with his own money and was written by ˀAśratä Maryam so that it might become for them a guide to the Kingdom of Heaven. Priests and deacons, do not take out this book from the sanctuary and do not spoil [it] as you spoiled many prayer books; may all the saints whose names are mentioned in this book be with the children of Dammo, major and minor; forever and ever. Amen.
additional.det: The note is written on a single loose leaf attached to the inner side of the front board. Its ruling pattern is different from that of the manuscript. It is questionable if the leaf originally belonged to the book since its commissioner and scribe (different from those mentioned here) are known from the colophon.

additional.tran: Fol. 176v: This Psalter was donated to Däbrä Dammo by ras Mikaˀel so that it might become salvation for his soul. He who will steal it or erase (its text) shall be excommunicated by the authority of Peter and Paul.
additional.det: The note states that ras Mikaʾel donated the Ms. to the monastery of Däbrä Dammo.

extras.extra: - The title of the Ms. ዳዊት and the internal number of the monastic library (352) are written on fol. 1r. - The midpoint of the the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 76) is marked on fol. 70r. as a stamp-like design with a cross in the centre and inscription: መንፈቅ ለዳዊት “Half of Dawit”. - Stamp-like design with an inscription after Ps. 90 (91), መዝሙር ፺ “Psalm 90”: fol. 84v. - Stamp with an inscription, ማኅተም ዘ፳ ራስ ሚካኤል ርእሰ መኳንንት (cf. GueCopMen vol. 1, p.318): fols. 148v, 157v. - Inscription in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic in a light red frame, እም አሌፍ እስከ፡ ታው ፳፪ ነው: fol. 115r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: 2v, 3r, 28v, 29r, 34r, 39v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 3r, 9v. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 11r, 154v. - Part of the text is illegible due to smeared ink: fol. 88v. - Omitted letters, words and passages are written interlineally and in the margins, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 3v, 19v, 20v, 30r, 38r, 56v, 69r, 78r, 89r, 94r, 98v, 101v, 110r, 111r, 114r, 122v, 151v, 153r, 154r, 155r, 156r, 169ra, 171ra, 172ra. - Erasures marked with a few red and black lines: fols. 33r, 35v, 39r, 48v, 94r, 109v, 112v, 154r, 156v, 169rb. - Erasures: fol. 47v. - Leaves facing the miniatures and harägs are dyed yellow: fols. 15r, 64r,76r, 159r.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper margin of fols. 16r, 24r, 32r, 40r, 49r, 57r, 65r, 73r, 81r, 89r, 97r, 105r, 113r, 121r, 129r, 137r, 145r, 153r, 161r, 169r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Coloured (green, yellow and red) threads inserted in the right upper corner of fols. 8r, 14v, 21v, 29r, 39v, 47v, 54r, 63v, 75v, 85r, 91r, 104r, 117r, 120r, 127r, 135r, 150r, 159r (at the beginning of a group of 10 Pss., Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat, Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy and Wǝddase Maryam). - A coloured thread inserted between fols. 27v and 28r.

miniature.info: Fol. 5v: Prophet Samuel anoints King David in the presence of Jesse (1 Sm. 16).
miniature.details: Legends: ወነሥአኒ፡ እምአባግዐ፡ አቡየ፨ ወቀብዐኒ፡ ቅብዐ፡ ቅዱስ፦ አኃውየሰ፡ ሠናያን፡ ወልሂቃን፦ ወኢሠምረ፡ ቦሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፦ (Ps. 151: 4-5) “And took me from my father’s sheep, and anointed me with his anointing-oil. My brothers were handsome and tall, but the Lord was not pleased with them”. In Amharic: ያሰኘው፡ ይህ፡ ነው “This is what he meant”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 6r: King David playing the harp.
miniature.details: Legends: ይቤ፡ ዳዊት፡ በመዝሙር። ሰብእሰ፡ ከንቶ፡ ይመስል፦ ወመዋዕሊሁኒ፡ ከመ፡ ጽላሎት፡ የኃልፍ፨ (Ps. 144: 4) “Man is like to vanity: his days [are] as a shadow that passes away”. ወካዕቤ፡ይቤ። እደውየ፡ ይገብራ፡ መሰንቆ፤ ወአፃብዕየ፡ ያስተዋድዶ፡ መዝሙረ፨ (Ps 151: 2) “My hands made a harp; my fingers fashioned a lyre”.

miniature.info: Fol. 6v: Däǧǧazmač Wäle reading the God’s Law.
miniature.details: Legend: ብፁዕ፡ ብእሲ፡ ደጃዝማች፡ ወሊ። ዘኢሖረ፡ በምክረ፡ ረሲዓን፨ ወዘሕጎ፡ ያነብብ፡ መዓልተ፡ ወሌሊተ፨ ወይከውን፡ ከመ፡ ዕፅ፤ እንተ፡ ትክልት፡ ኀበ፡ ሙሐዘ፡ ማይ፤ እንተ፡ ትሁብ፡ ፍሬሃ፡ በበጊዜሃ፤ ውእቱኒ፡ ከማሃ፨ (Passages from Ps 1) “Blessed is däǧǧazmač Wäle. Nor stands in the way of sinners. And in his law does he meditate day and night. And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that brings forth its fruit in its season. He too is like it”. In Amharic: ይህ ነው “This is it”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
A coloured (red, dark, blues, yellow) cross on each side of the folio decorated with cut-work (pieces of parchment cut between the interlaces).

miniature.info: Fol. 31r: An angel with two swords.
miniature.details: Illustration of Ps. 34:7, “The angel of the Lord encamps round about them that fear him, and delivers them”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 53v: Two men sitting on cushions symbolizing lightness or vanity.
miniature.details: One of them holds scales with a ball symbolizing man’s life on the lighter scale pan and a few balls symbolizing vanity on the heavier scale pan. Illustration of the initial Psalm of the group of Pss. 62-71. Legend: ሐሳውያን፡ ደቂቀ፡ እጓለ፡ እምሕያው፡ ይዒምፁ፡ መዳልወ፡፦ እሙንቱሰ፡ እምከንቱ፡ ውስተ፡ ከንቱ፡ ክመ፡፦ (Ps. 62:9) “Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: if laid on the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”.

Illustration of the initial psalm of Pss. 72-81. Legends: ወግብተ፡ መጽኡ፡ ሐራ፡ ሰማይ (Lk 2:13) “And […] there was […] a multitude of the heavenly host”. ቤተ፡ ልሔም፦ “Bethlehem”. ኮከብ፡ መርሆሙ “The Star led them”. ነገሥተ፡ ተርሲስ፡ ወደሰያት፡ አምኃ፡ ያበውዑ፤ ነገሥተ፡ ሳባ፡ ወአረብ፡ ጋዳ፡ ያመጽኡ፦ (Ps. 72: 10) “The kings of Tarshish and of the coasts shall bring presents: the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 75v, above: The fall of the angel.
miniature.details: Legends: አንትሙሰ፡ ከመ፡ ሰብእ፡ ትመውቱ። ወከመ፡ ፩ እመላእክት፡ ትወድቁ፡፦ (Ps. 82:7) “But you shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. Fol. 75v, below: Mourners with the deceased between the devils (on the left) and the angels (on the right). Legends: መላእክተ፡ ጽልመት “The Angel of Darkness”. መላእክተ፡ ብርሃን “The Angel of Light”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.
Illustration of Ps. 91:11, “For he shall give his angels charge over you, to keep you in all your ways”.

miniature.info: Fol. 90v: A kind of donkey, a bird in a house, a hermit.
miniature.details: Legends: ወኮንኩ፡ ከመ፡ ዓድገ፡ መረብ፡ ዘገዳም፦ (Ps. 102:6) “I am like a vulture of the wilderness”. In the Gǝʿǝz translation “a vulture” is ዓድገ፡ መረብ, “a pelican”, but the painter associated ዓድገ with ዓድጊ, which means “donkey” in Tǝgrǝñña. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. ዖፍ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ ውስተ፡ ናሕስ፦ (Ps. 102: 7) “… a sparrow alone upon the house top”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. ብእሲ፡ ባሕታዊ፡ ይህ፡ ነው “This is a hermit”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 116v: A round church between two trees. In the foreground: on the left ደጃች ወሊ (däǧǧač Wäli) with a prayer book and on the right ወይዘሮ ስሂን (wäyzäro Sǝhin) with a string of prayer beads.
miniature.details: Legend: ወቆማ፡ አገሪነ፡ ውስተ፡ አዕፃድኪ፡ ኢየሩሳሌም (Ps 122: 2) “Our feet shall stand within your gates, O Jerusalem”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 127r: A little face surrounded by a chain.
miniature.details: A little face surrounded by a chain (an illustration of Ps. 142:7 “Bring my soul out of prison”). In Amharic: ያሰኘው፡ ይህ፡ ነው “This is what he meant” The same face is painted in the same place on the reverse side (fol. 127v).

miniature.info: Fol. 134r: David and defeated Goliath, Saul giving the armour to David.
miniature.details: Legends: አንሰ፡ ነሣእኩ፡ ፫ተ፡ አዕባነ፡ እም፡ ውስተ፡ ፈለግ፠ ወወፀፍክዎ፡ እንተ፡ ፍጽሙ፠ አሚሃ፡ ወድቀ፡ በኃይለ፡ እግዚአብሔር፠ ጎልያድ፡ ያርብሐዊ። (Ps. 151: between 6 and 7, verses not present in the Septuagint) “I took three stones out of the brook” (cf. 1 Sm. 17: 40) And I slung it in his forehead; At that moment [he] fell down by the power of God; Gigantic Goliath” (cf. 1 Sm. 17:49). In Amharic: ይህ ነው “This is it”. ለእመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ወልታ፡ ወኵናተ፧ ይቤ፡ ዳዊት፡ ኢለመድኩ፡ በዝ፡ ግብር፠ (1 Sm. 17:39) “When he gave him a shield and a spear David said, ‘I am not accustomed to using it’”. ልብሱ፡ ለጎልያድ፡ ጥሩር፡ ውእቱ፠ “Goliath’s clothes were (?)”.

miniature.info: Fol. 134v: Pharaoh and his host are drowning in the Red sea; Archangel Mikael in a cloud; Moses with a rod and the Israelites; Miriam beating the timbrel.
miniature.details: Legends: ሠረገላቲሁ፡ ለፈርዖን፡ ወሠራዊቶ፡ ወረወ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕር፡፦ ወተሠጥሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ባሕረ፡ ኤርትራ፡፦ (Ex 15:4) “Pharaoh's chariots and his host has he cast into the sea: [they] are drowned in the Red sea”. In Amharic: ይህ ነው “This is it”. ወይቤሎ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለሙሴ፡ ዝብጣ፡ ለባሕር፡፦ “And Mikael said to Moses ‘Strike the sea’” (cf. Ex. 14:19). እኅተ፡ ሙሴ፡ ዘበጠት፡ ከበሮ Moses‘ “Sister beat the timbrel” (cf. Ex. 15:20).

miniature.info: Fol. 149r: Prophet Simeon with the child Jesus, Mary and Joseph in the Temple.
miniature.details: Legend: ልደተ፡ ስምዖን፡ ነቢይ “Birth of Prophet Simeon”. In Amharic: ይህ ነው “This is it”. ዘከመ፡ ቦዓ፡ እግዚእነ፡ በ፵፡ ዕለት፡ ቤተ፡ መቅደስ፡ እኂዞ፡ እጓለ፡ ርግብ፦ “As the Lady entered the Temple in the 40th day with a baby dove.” (cf. Lk. 2:24)

King Solomon, two mothers, the deceased child and two soldiers about to divide the living child into two. Legends: በከመ ፈትሐ። ንጉሥ ሰሎሞን። ወይቤ ቅትልዎ ለሕፃን ወሀቦ መንፈቆ ለዛቲ ወመንፈቆ ለእንታክቲ፠ (1 Kings 3:25) “How judged King Solomon and said, ‘Killed the child and give half to the one, and half to the other’”. In Amharic: ይህ ነው “This is it”. ቤተ ንጉሥ “The King’s Palace”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

miniature.info: Fol. 158v: St. Mary with Adam and Eve behind Her, St. Efraim and a beggar.
miniature.details: Legends: አዳም ወሄዋን “Adam and Eve”. ወድሰኒ ትቤሎ “She says to him: ‘Praise me’”. ባርክኒ ይቤላ “He says to her: ‘Bless me’”. ኤፍሬም ለብሐዊ “Efraim the Potter”. ፩ ነዳይ ተመጽዋቲ “A beggar, almsperson”. The miniature is protected by a textile curtain.

frames.frame: Elaborate ornamental bands separate from each other: a group of 10 Pss., Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat, Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy and Wǝddase Maryam. At the top of some of them, there is a miniature illustrating one of the Pss. from the group, most often the first one. On the subsequent folio, a relevant verse from the psalm is written on a yellow background within a red frame. Fol. 8r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces, and floral motifs. At the top a floral motif between two crosses interlaced with floral motifs. Fol. 14v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 11:2: two hypocrite men talking to each other. They exchange a warm handshake with their right hands, while one of the men points an accusatory finger to the other. Fol. 15r: legends written on a yellow background within a red frame: ከንቶ፡ ይትናገሩ፡ ፩ ምስለ፡ ካልዑ (Ps. 11: 2) “They speak vanity every one with his neighbour”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. Fol. 21v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 22:18: four men casting lots. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 22r: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ወተካፈሉ፡ አልባስየ፡ ለርእሶሙ፦ ወተዓፀው፡ ዲበ፡ ዓራዝየ፦ ፬፡ ሐራ፡ ሰገራት፦ (Ps. 22:18) “They part my garments among them, and cast lots for my clothing”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. Fol. 28v: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ፈረሰኒ፡ ሐሰት፡ ኢያድኅን፦ ወኢያመስጥ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ጽንዑ፦ (Ps. 33: 17) “A horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”. Fol. 29r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 33:17: a man fallen from a fleeing horse. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 39v: elaborate coloured (violet, orange, green and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, a hart (a deer) giving birth and crying from pain; on both her sides are brooks. The hart is mentioned in Ps. 42: 1. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 40r: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame, in Amharic: ኃየል፡ ማለት፡ ዋልያ፡ ናት፡፦ የዋልያ፡ ምጽ፡ ይህ፡ ነው፡፦ “Ḫayäl means a deer. Deer’s birth pangs are these”. Fol. 47v: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, most probably flowering olive trees (illustration of Ps. 52:8): “But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever”. Fol. 54r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, floral motifs and two crosses. Fol. 64r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, floral motifs and one cross. Fol. 76r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. Fol. 85r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 91r: elaborate coloured (light violet, yellow, orange, green, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. Fol. 104r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 117r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. Fol. 120r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain. Fol. 127r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue, light brown) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, at the top floral motifs and a cross. Fol. 135r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs; at the top floral motifs. Fol. 150r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, red, yellow, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs; at the top two flowers and two birds. Fol. 159r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, red, yellow, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up, two pointed down and one extended pendant in the middle pointed down; interlaces, floral and anthropomorfic motifs; at the top flower motifs. Fol. 176r: coloured (red, green, violet, yellow) band; interlaces.
